intro: Manisuris ratnagirica, commonly known as the Ratnagiri manisuris, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
